turns.speaker: ANAMARIA
turns.text: You stole my boat.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: AnaMaria!  Have you seen Gibbs?  I need to put together --

turns.speaker: ANAMARIA
turns.text: My dory.  The Jolly Mon.  Where is it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Safe!  At Port Royal.  With the Royal Navy.

turns.speaker: ANAMARIA
turns.text: That boat is my livelihood!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You'll get it back.  Or one better.

turns.speaker: ANAMARIA
turns.text: I will.

turns.speaker: ANAMARIA
turns.text: How does he do that?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: They'll be anchored on the lee side.  Haul your wind, and keep to the weather of the island --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: AnaMaria, trim the mainsail!

turns.speaker: ANAMARIA
turns.text: Aye, aye, sir!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Mr. Gibbs, organize a cleaning detail -- you and Cotton.  I want every inch of the Pearl spic-and- span and ship-shape!

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: What's in your head, boy?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: She.  Goes.  Free.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: You've got one shot -- and we can't die.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You can't.  I can.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Enough of that!  Name your terms.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Elizabeth goes free!

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: We got that part.  Anything else?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: And Jack.  And the crew.  Free and unharmed.  If you agree ... then ... I will remain with you.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: You must swear by the Holy Bible.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Eh?  You have my word, then -- on the Good Book, I do swear, and the Lord spare my worthless soul.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: No!  You gave your word!

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Quite, boy, or you'll lose your tongue.  Those as know me know I wouldn't cross my word, and bring down bad luck on the ship.  I agreed to set them free.  I didn't when ... nor where.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Hah.  Ten years you carried that pistol, and you end up wasting your shot.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: He didn't waste it.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I know whose blood you need, to end the curse.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Say the name, or I slit your throat.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No you won't.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Allow me the humor of listening to your terms.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Simple.  I have something you won't more than anything.  The way to free you from the curse of the treasure.  You have something I want -- more than anything.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: The Pearl?  Oh, that's fine.  And just how do you expect this to work?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You give me the Pearl.  Then I tell you who you need.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: That's your offer?  You, sailing away nice and pretty with the Black Pearl, and all I have is a name?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: I'm supposed to ... trust you?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You see, I've got this honest streak in me -- in its own way, a sort of curse.  Oh, and there's the fact that you have no choice.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: I'll torture it out of you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You left me on a desert island -- what worse can you do?

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Blast you!  I'll throw you in prison.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Wait as long as you like.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: You're setting me up for a double cross, you with the ship, and me with nothing more than your word!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Let's say I tell you the wrong person.  What would you do?

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Track you down and --

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Jack, I don't trust you, and that's a fact.  Never trust a smiling man, you can lay to that.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: See, that's where we're different. I trust you ... to do what it takes to get what you want.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: You're playing this as close to the edge as any man, I'll give you that.  We might just have to sign articles, you and I.  Jack, you're a pirate at heart, that's certain.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What -- you don't have the medallion?

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: That fool woman took it.  You be careful around her, Jack -- she's pretty enough, she'll steal your heart -- but pure evil inside.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'll watch my back.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Bosun!  Set up Mr. Sparrow's quarters, nice and fine ... in the brig.  Meaning no disrespect, of course.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It's pure evil to make a Captain walk the plank of his own ship, twice in one lifetime.  No good can come of it.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Now, Jack.  That reef is less than a league distant.  It's a square deal all around, and you can't hope for better.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Someone needs to cut these bonds, then.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: You'd best take a swim, Jack.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The last time you do this, you left me a pistol, with one shot.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: So how did you get off that island, anyway?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You can go to your grave not knowing.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: That's fair.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: No, I really think I do.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: All right then.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Why don't I want to do this?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Because, right about now, the H.M.S. Dauntless is lying in wait in the harbor.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You've no hope of surviving Norrington's attack ... that is, if you're mortal.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: What're you suggesting?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Like after you've killed ... Every ... Last ... One ... of Norrington's men.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: I can't help wondering, Jack, why you're being so helpful and all? Last time you did that, it didn't end well for you.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The situation has changed.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: That so?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Aye.  See, after you're done with the Royal Navy, you'll have a bit of a problem: the H.M.S. Dauntless. There you'll be, with two lovely ships on your hands, and what to do?  Of course you'll decide you deserve the bigger one, and who's to argue?  The Dauntless a first- rate ship-of-line, and with it, you can rule the seas.  But if you're Captain of the Dauntless, who's left for the Black Pearl?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Now, you can take care of the Dauntless, right?

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Men!  Are you up for it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: There's ... another exit?

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Aye, for us there is.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Just so you know, Jack -- I don't think you're that clever.  I think you're a fool.  A mortal fool.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Remarkable how often those two traits coincide.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: So what now, Jack Sparrow?  Are we to be two immortals, locked in epic battle until the trumpets of Judgement Day?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Or you could surrender.

turns.speaker: PINTEL
turns.text: Now?

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Now.  No, don't kill him.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Looks like your back to having nothing to offer.

turns.speaker: PINTEL
turns.text: And he's got Old Bill's courage. A curse on him, and you!

turns.speaker: PINTEL
turns.text: That's proper, sir, according to the code.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: By the powers, you're right!  Where's Jack's pistol?  Who's got it?  Bring it forward!

turns.speaker: PINTEL
turns.text: No reason to fret.  It's just a prick of the finger and a few drops of blood.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Turner blood doesn't flow pure in his veins.  Best play it safe, and spill it all.

turns.speaker: PINTEL
turns.text: I guess there is a reason to fret.

turns.speaker: PINTEL
turns.text: Do you believe him?

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: No.  But him I believe.  He us genuinely angry.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: My apologies, miss.  As you were saying, before you were so rudely interrupted?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Captain Barbossa ... I have come to negotiate the cessation of hostilities against Port Royal.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: There was a lot of long words in there, miss, and we're not but humble pirates.  What is it you want?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I want you to leave.  And never come back.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: I am disinclined to acquiesce to your request.  Means 'No.'

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Very well.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I'll drop it!

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: My holds are bursting with swag. That bit of shine matters to me ... Why?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Because it's what you're searching for.  You've been searching for it for years.  I recognize this ship. I saw it eight years ago, when we made the crossing from England.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Did you, now?

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: You have a name, missy?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Elizabeth --  Turner.  I'm a maid in the governor's household.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: You've got sand, for a maid.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Thank you, sir.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: And how does a maid come to own a trinket such as that?  A family heirloom, perhaps?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Of course.  I didn't steal it, if that's what you mean.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: No, no, nothing like that.  Very well.  You hand that over, we'll put your town to our rudder and ne'er return.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Can I trust you?

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: It's you who invoked the parlay! Believe me, Miss, you'd best hand it over, now ... or these be the last friendly words you'll hear!

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Maid or not, it fits you.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Dare I ask the fate of it previous owner?

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Now, none of that.  Please dig in.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Oh, there would be no sense in killing you, Miss Turner.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Then why aren't you eating?

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Would that I could.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Do you not know what this is, then?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: It's a pirate medallion.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: It's a piece of the treasure of Isla de Muerta.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: The curse drove you to gather this?

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Aye.  And not a bit of it any use to us, only hoarded.  But it will drive us no longer.

turns.speaker: BARBOSSA
turns.text: Agreed.  You have my word, as a gentleman of fortune --

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Will -- you can't trust him.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I think it would be rather exciting to meet a pirate.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: Think again, Miss Swann. Vile and dissolute creatures, the lot of them. I intend to see to it that any man who sails under a pirate flag, or wears a pirate brand, gets what he deserves: a short drop and a sudden stop.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: Man overboard!

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Boy overboard!

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: Fetch a hook -- haul him out of there!

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: Did he speak?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: His name is Will Turner -- that's all I found out.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: Very good.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: I apologize if I seem forward -- but I must speak my mind.  This promotion confirms that I have accomplished the goals I set for myself in my career.  But it also casts into sharp relief that which I have not achieved.  The thing all men most require: a marriage to a fine woman.  You have become a fine woman, Elizabeth.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I can't breathe.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: I'm a bit nervous, myself --

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Commodore, I must protest.  Pirate or not, this man saved my life.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: One good deed is not enough to redeem a man of a lifetime of wickedness.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: On his heels!  Gillette, bring a squad down from the fort!  Elizabeth, are you --

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Yes, I'm all right, I'm fine!  Go capture him.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: Elizabeth, I'm relieved you're safe.  Clap him in irons.  And behind his back this time.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Commodore, you can't do that!

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: You're speaking up for him again?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: He can locate Isla de Muerta -- but I doubt he'll be willing to help us from the brig.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: No.  The pirates have taken Will --

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: Your father is frantic with worry. Our mission was to rescue you and return home.  That is what we shall do.  Mr. Turner's fate is regrettable.  But so was his decision to engage in piracy.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Commodore, please!

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Commodore, I beg you -- please do this ... for me.  As a wedding gift.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: I am to understand that you will accept my marriage proposal on the condition I rescue Mr. Turner?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Not as a condition -- a request.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: Elizabeth, I hereby withdraw my proposal.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: I know where your heart truly lies.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: You may seclude yourself in my cabin.  I'm afraid we do not have any ladies' clothing aboard.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Then I can wear men's clothing.

turns.speaker: NORRINGTON
turns.text: That would hardly be proper.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Well, I am not going to stay hidden in some cabin, or I suppose it's going to be heaving bosoms and bare for the remainder of the voyage!

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Actually, I find it all fascinating.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: And that's what concerns me. Elizabeth, we will be landing in Port Royal soon, and beginning our new lives. Wouldn't it be wonderful if we comport ourselves as befits our class and station?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Yes, father.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Elizabeth? Is everything all right? Are you decent?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Yes -- yes.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: It's -- beautiful. May I inquire as to the occasion?

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Is an occasion necessary for a father to dote upon his daughter with gifts?

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Although ... I did think you could wear it to the ceremony today.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Ceremony?

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Captain Norrington's promotion ceremony.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I knew it.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Or, rather, Commodore Norrington ... a fine gentleman, don't you think?  He fancies you, you know.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Difficult ... to say.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: I'm told that dress is the very latest fashion in London.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Women in London must have learned to not breathe.

turns.speaker: SWANN
turns.text: Elizabeth, this is hardly appropriate --

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: About the day we met. Do you remember?

turns.speaker: PINTEL
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Parlay!  I invoke the right of parlay!  According to the Code of the Brethern, set down by the pirates Morgan and Bartholomew, you must take me to your Captain!

turns.speaker: PINTEL
turns.text: I know the code.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: If an adversary demands parlay, you can do them no harm until the parlay is complete.

turns.speaker: PINTEL
turns.text: It would appear, so do you.

turns.speaker: PINTEL
turns.text: You'll be dining with the Captain, and he requests you wear this.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Tell the captain that I am disinclined to acquiesce to his request.

turns.speaker: PINTEL
turns.text: He said you say that!  He also said if that be the case, you'll be dining with the crew, and you'll be naked.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I could never forget it, Miss Swann.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Will, how many times must I ask you to call me 'Elizabeth'?

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: At least once more, Miss Swann. As always.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I'm glad we got here in time.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Truthfully -- you were a bit late.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Why would my father send this to me?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: To keep it away from them?  No pirate would sail to London, for fear of Execution Dock.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: If I had known --

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: -- then we never would have met.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I can't believe he would make such a sacrifice for us.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: I guess you can never truly know someone else's heart.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: There.  And don't you dare tell me that wasn't a proper kiss!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Elizabeth, I think it doesn't matter that we are of a different class --

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: It doesn't!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: -- but that was not a proper kiss.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Miss Swann.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Miss Swann, if you'll be so kind?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: You are despicable.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I saved your life; now you've saved mine.  We're square.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: You?!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Me!

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: You're in league with Barbossa!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No, I'm -- rescuing you.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Come on!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: No.  This won't work.  I'll stay behind, and fight them. You go on.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Has it changed since the last time you were here?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: The trees are taller.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Captain Sparrow!  We have to get off this island -- immediately!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't be thinking I'm not already working on it.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: What?  What's wrong?  How will this help us get off the island?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: It won't.  It won't, and so we won't.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: But ... you did it before!  Last time --

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Last time, I was here a grand total of three days.  Last time, the rumrunners who used this island as a cache came by, and I bartered passage off.  But from the looks of this, they've been out of business, and so that won't be happening again.  We probably have your friend Norrington to thank for that.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: So that's it?  That's the secret grand adventure of the infamous Jack Sparrow?  You spent three days on the beach drinking rum?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Welcome to the Caribbean, love.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You should look at our contretemps this way: we've got shade trees, thank the Lord.  We've got some food on the trees, thank the Lord again.  And we've got rum, praise the Lord.  We can stay alive a month, maybe more.  Keep a weather eye open for passing ships, and our chances are fair.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: A month?  Will doesn't have a month!  We've got to do something to help him!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You're right.  Here's luck to you, Will Turner.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Don't be thinking I'm happy about this, Elizabeth.  But I see no use in wailing and gnashing my teeth over that which I can do nothing about.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Not when you can drink instead, at least.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Drink up me hearties, yo ho ...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What?  What was that?  Something funny, Miss Swann? Share, please.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Nothing ... it's nothing.  Just ... I'm reminded of a song I learned as a child.  A song about pirates.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I know a lot of songs about pirates, but none I'd teach a child.  Let's hear it.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Oh, no ... it's silly.  Back in England we didn't know a thing about pirates, really.  They seemed so romantic and daring --

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: That was before I met one, of course.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Now I must hear this song.  An authentic pirate song.  Have at it.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Well, perhaps ... with a bit more to drink, I might ...

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: More to drink!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: When I get the Black Pearl back, I'm going to teach it to the whole crew, and we'll sing it all the time!

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: You'll be positively the most fearsome pirates to sail the Spanish Main.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Jack, it must be so terrible for you, to be trapped here on this island, all over again.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ah, well ... the company is better than last time.  And the scenery has definitely improved.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Mr. Sparrow!  I'm not sure I've had enough rum to allow that kind of talk.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We've got a few bottles left ... and we've yet to tap the kegs.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: To freedom.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: To the Black Pearl.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: What are you doing?  You've burned our food, the shade -- the rum!

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Yes, the rum is gone.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: One, because it is a vile drink that turns even the most respectable men into scoundrels. Two --

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: That signal is over a thousand feet high, which means it can be seen for two hundred leagues in every direction.  The entire Royal Navy is out to sea looking for me -- do you think there is even a chance they could miss it?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: You -- you burned up the island, for a one-time chance at being spotted?

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: You didn't tell Commodore Norrington everything.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Nor did you, I noticed.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: He might delay the rescue ... and that would be too late.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Exactly.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: These men will be facing an enemy that seemingly cannot be killed.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I have a plan.  If it succeeds, then any battle will be decidedly brief ... and one-sided.

turns.speaker: ELIZABETH
turns.text: What's your plan?

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Curse you for breathing, you slack- jawed idiot.  Mother's love, Jack, you know better than to wake a man when he's sleeping.  It's bad luck!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Well, fortunately, I know how to counter it.  The man who did the waking buys the man who was sleeping a drink, and the man who was sleeping it drinks it while listening to a proposition.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Aye, that'll about do it.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Make it last, then.  Now, what's the nature of this venture of yours?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: First -- have you found me a crew?

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Oh, there's a hard tale, Jack. Most of the decent pirates in town won't sail with you -- seem to think you're a jinx.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Now where, I wonder, would they have gotten that idea?

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Say again?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: I'm going after the Black Pearl. I know where it's going to be, and I'm going to take it.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Jack, it's a fool's errand: You've heard the tales they tell about the Pearl.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Aye, and that's why I know where it's going to be, and that's why I know what Barbossa is up to.  All I need is a crew.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: A fool's errand.

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Not if the fool has something Barbossa wants.  Something he needs.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: And you've got that, have you?

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Kid's a bit of a stick, isn't he?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: That he is.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: We'd best drop canvas, sir!

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: She can hold a bit longer.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: What's in your head to put you in such a fine mood?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: We're catching up!

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: How did you get off the island?

turns.speaker: JACK
turns.text: Ah, that's a dark and unpleasant tale, best left untold.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Blast it, I'm already awake!

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: I know.  That was for the smell.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: How do we expect to find an island no one can find -- with a compass that doesn't work?

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Now, lad, just because it don't point north don't mean it don't work.  That compass gives bearings to the Isla de Muerta, wherever it may lay.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: Really?  So ... what's the story on the pistol?

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: I'll tell lee.  Now, Jack Sparrow has an honest streak in him, and that's where the whole problem starts.  This was when he was Captain of the Black Pearl --

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: What?  He never told me that.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Ah -- he's learned, then.  Plays things more close to the vest. See, Jack was a cartographer, back in Old England.  Somehow he came by the money to commission the Pearl. Hired himself a crew, promised each man an equal share.  So, they're forty days out, and the First Mate says, everything's an equal share, that should mean the location of the island, too.  So Jack gave up the bearings.  That night, there was a mutiny.

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Jack gave hisself up for the sake of his loyal crew.  He was marooned on an island, left there to die.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: How did he get off the island?

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: It's a signal.  If we resist, it won't just be death.  There'll be torture as well.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: We're not going to just surrender!

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: That we are.

turns.speaker: WILL
turns.text: We can at least fight -- we might be able to kill a few--

turns.speaker: GIBBS
turns.text: Will -- it'll go worse for us -- for Elizabeth, especially -- if we fight.
